name: Barry Park
description: This 12+ acre park offers plenty of outdoor recreation and nature preservation opportunities for all to enjoy.

name: Burnet Park
description: Burnet Park, located in Syracuse's historic Tipperary Hill, is a multi-use park that spans 88 acres featuring a golf course, swimming pool, multiple athletic fields, a tennis court and basketball court.

name: Clark Spaulding Field
description: Located adjacent to Meachem Elementary School, this park is classified in playlots, fields & courts. It is home to two baseball fields and backs up to the Syracuse City School District's playground.

name: Clinton Square
description: Clinton Square continues to be a gathering place where tens of thousands get together every year -- Whether to ice skate from late Nov. to March, take part in a walk or run, or to celebrate at one of the many festivals during the warmer months.

name: Columbus Circle
description: Located in the downtown section of Syracuse featuring a large fountain and Columbus Monument surrounded cultural and institutional facilities such as churches, a library and a courthouse.

name: Comfort Tyler Park
description: This 3+ acre park offers plenty of outdoor recreation and is classified as a neighborhood park.

name: Cummings Field
description: Located in Eastwood, this park is home to three little league fields, a concession stand and a swing set.

name: Eastwood Heights
description: With almost 4 acres of green space this neighborhood park offers several recreational opportunities, including a half basketball court.

name: Elmwood Park
address: Elmwood Park, 919 Glenwood Ave, Syracuse, NY 13207
description: This 65 acre community park, on the southside of the city, features picturesque bridges, walls and staircases made of rustic stone throughout, and is home to Furnace Brook stream.

name: Fayette Firefighters Memorial Park
description: Surrounded by a beautiful cast iron fence, this park is home to two monuments and a memorial dedicated to brave fallen firefighters of the Syracuse Fire Department.

name: Forman Park
description: Forman Park is just over one acre of land located in between East Genesee Street, Almond Street and Forman Ave. The park is home to a statue of Joshua Forman and Lewis Hamilton Redfield, along with, the Syracuse Police Memorial.

name: Franklin Square Park
address: Franklin Square Park, 101 Solar St, Syracuse, NY 13204
description: This picturesque park is a popular backdrop for many brides and grooms. This enchanting green space at the corner of Plum and Solar Streets features a fountain, arbors and magnificently-colored flowers in season.

name: Grace Massena Playlot
description: This adorable playlot is located on the westside of the Syracuse on the corner of Grace Street and Massena Street. If features a beautiful playground and plenty of seating.

name: Hanover Square
description: This Downtown park is home to pubs, restaurants, loft living, businesses and more.

name: Homer Wheaton Park
description: This 11+ acre neighborhood park includes a little league field, tennis court, basketball court and a pretty cool playground.

name: Huntington Park
description: With just over 3 acres of space, this neighborhood park sits behind Huntington K-8 School and close to the District's playground. The space features a skate park popular among the skateboard, bmx and in-line skating community.

name: Kirk Park
address: Kirk Park, 1101 South Ave, Syracuse, NY 13207
description: This 33 acre park, located on the southside of Syracuse, features a community center, outdoor swimming pool and a variety of athletic fields and courts.
tags: Athletic Court, Athletic Field, Multi-Use Park

name: Leavenworth Park
description: This neighborhood park features a beautiful gazebo at its center, a playground at the east end, and plenty of open green space to enjoy throughout.

name: Lewis Park
description: This neighborhood park offers plenty of outdoor recreation opportunities with multiple little leagues fields, basketball courts and a playground with play features for ages 2-12.

name: Libba Cotten Grove
description: This neighborhood park, on the southside of Syracuse, features a basketball court, a beautiful playground, a statue of the legendary Elizabeth 'Libba' Cotten as well as a large open green space for recreational fun.

name: Lincoln Park
description: Located in the northeast section of Syracuse. this 19-acre neighborhood park, features basketball courts, a tennis court, a playground and a large, wooded area.

name: Lipe Art Park
description: Lipe Art Park is an intriguing blend of public art project, outdoor venue, and recreational space, sprawling across approximately 2 acres in the city's Warehouse District.

name: McChesney Park
description: This neighborhood park, on the northside of Syracuse, boasts two basketball courts, two tennis courts with pickleball lines, a beautiful playground and recreation center for youth and seniors.

name: McKinley Park
description: This neighborhood park, on the southside of Syracuse, boasts two basketball courts, an outdoor pool, a spray feature, a beautiful playground and a large open green space for recreational fun.

name: Meachem Field
address: Meachem Field, 121 W. Seneca Trpk, Syracuse, NY 13205
description: Located alongside the Onondaga Creek on the City's South Side, this park is home to multiple softball fields, lighted tennis/pickleball courts, an ice skating rink, and a playground.

name: Norwood Park
address: Norwood Park, 393 Ashdale Ave, Syracuse, NY 13206
description: This neighborhood park, with over 8 acres of land, features two football fields and a beautiful new playground.

name: Onondaga Creekwalk
address: Along Onondaga Creekwalk, Syracuse, NY Various
description: The Onondaga Creekwalk trail is 4.8 miles of an accessible pathway designed for bicyclists, skaters, and pedestrians to take in the rich history and vibrant culture of Syracuse. The trail runs, mostly, parallel to Onondaga Creek connecting Syracuse's Southside neighborhood, through Downtown's historic Armory Square, and then on to Onondaga Lake, a birder's paradise.

name: Onondaga Park - Lower
address: Onondaga Park, 655 Onondaga Ave, Syracuse, NY 13207
description: This 16 acre park is a wonderful place to wander and explore. See the stone bridge arch, fountain, and greenhouse. The park has a great spray fountain and playground for all ages to enjoy.

name: Onondaga Park - Upper
address: Upper Onondaga Park, 655 Onondaga Ave, Syracuse, NY 13207
description: This 67 acre park is situated on the City's south side, in the Strathmore neighborhood. This park is home to Hiawatha Lake, multiple tennis courts, 3 basketball courts, a playground and a swimming pool.

name: Ormand Spencer Park
description: Spanning seven acres, Ormand Spencer Park is home to the city of Syracuse's only dog park. The park also features basketball courts and a playground.

name: Schiller Park
description: Classified as a community park, this 37+ acre park is located on the northside of Syracuse and boasts a swimming pool, tennis courts, a soccer field and a community center.

name: Sheridan Park
description: This neighborhood park is tucked behind Fire Station #17 between S. Midler Ave and Nichols Ave, in Eastwood. The park features a 9/11 memorial and a firetruck to climb on.

name: Sherman Park
address: Sherman Park, 1401 Westmoreland Ave, Syracuse, NY 13210
description: Nestled in a university neighborhood, Sherman Park features two little league fields and comes in at just over 2 acres.

name: Skiddy Park
description: Skiddy Park, located on the westside of Syracuse, is a neighborhood park that spans 2.75 acres featuring a playground, futsol court, a multi-purpose field, 2 basketball courts and a field house.

name: Spirit of Jubilee Park
description: At just over 2 acres of green space, this neighborhood park on the southside of the city features a tennis court, a basketball court and a playground.

name: Sunnycrest Park
description: Sunnycrest Park is a multi-purpose park. The athletic fields and ice rink are located at 698 Robinson Street. The golf course and winter lodge are located at 100 Caleb Ave, off of Hickok Ave on the Eastside of Syracuse.

name: Thornden Park
description: This 76 acre community park on the eastside of the city features the E.M. Mills Rose Garden, a lily pond, an outdoor pool, a playground, athletic courts, a rentable pavilion and plenty of green spaces to enjoy.

name: Union Park
address: Lower Union Park, 1001 S Salina St, Syracuse, NY 13202
description: This neighborhood park features a beautiful playground and spray feature.

name: Washington Square Park
description: Nestled on the North Side of Syracuse, this neighborhood park features plenty of recreational opportunities.

name: Westmoreland Park
description: Westmoreland Park is 2.50 acres and features a covered basketball court, community center and playground.

name: Wilson Park
address: Wilson Park, 1117 S. McBride Street, Syracuse, NY 13202
description: Wilson Park is just over 2 acres and features 2 basketball courts, a community center, outdoor pool, playground and water feature.
